distribution.text: Copyright 2023 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for bind fixes several issues.

This security issue was fixed:

- CVE-2017-3145: Improper sequencing during cleanup could have lead to a
  use-after-free error that triggered an assertion failure and crash in named
  (bsc#1076118).

These non-security issues were fixed:

- Updated named.root file (bsc#1040039)
- Update bind.keys for DNSSEC root KSK rollover (bsc#1047184)
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.title: Terms of use

notes.text: BIND was improperly sequencing cleanup operations on upstream recursion fetch contexts, leading in some cases to a use-after-free error that can trigger an assertion failure and crash in named. Affects BIND 9.0.0 to 9.8.x, 9.9.0 to 9.9.11, 9.10.0 to 9.10.6, 9.11.0 to 9.11.2, 9.9.3-S1 to 9.9.11-S1, 9.10.5-S1 to 9.10.6-S1, 9.12.0a1 to 9.12.0rc1.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
